   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Check if running on colab\n",
    "try:\n",
    "  import google.colab\n",
    "  IN_COLAB = True\n",
    "except:\n",
    "  IN_COLAB = False\n",
    "\n",
    "# pip install any missing packages\n",
    "if IN_COLAB:\n",
    "  !pip install equadratures # for standard pip install"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {
    "id": "2Oos-lpfEQXI"
   },
   "source": [
    "# Persistence of equadratures objects\n",
    "\n",
    "Persistence of `equadratures` objects might be desirable in many workflows, for example when saving a fitted `Poly` to make future predictions, or for record keeping. Starting in v9.1.0, `equadratures` objects can now be serialised with the `pickle` python standard library. \n",
    "\n",
    "## Serialisation\n",
    "To serialise, use `pickle.dumps()`. For example, for a `Poly` object:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 48,
   "metadata": {
    "id": "t7S4oiWGEQXK"
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Fit a simple 1D polynomial\n",
    "import equadratures as eq\n",
    "f = lambda x: (1.0 - 3*x[0])**2 + 100.0 \n",
    "myparams = eq.Parameter(distribution='uniform', order=2, lower=-1.0, upper=1.0)\n",
    "mybasis = eq.Basis('tensor-grid')\n",
    "mypoly = eq.Poly(parameters=myparams, basis=mybasis, \\\n",
    "                 method='numerical-integration')\n",
    "mypoly.set_model(f)\n",
    "\n",
    "# Serialise\n",
    "import pickle\n",
    "serial = pickle.dumps(mypoly)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "The serialised object can be unserialised with `pickle.loads()`:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 49,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 576x432 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {
      "needs_background": "light"
     },
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "mypoly = pickle.loads(serial)\n",
    "mypoly.plot_polyfit_1D(uncertainty=False)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## File storage\n",
    "To save and load to and from files, `dumps` and `loads` can be replaced with `dump` and `load`. For example:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 50,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Save to pickle file\n",
    "with open('data/mypoly.pickle', 'wb') as f:\n",
    "    pickle.dump(mypoly, f)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 51,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "<equadratures.poly.Poly at 0x1486f5518>"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 51,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "# Load from file\n",
    "with open('data/mypoly.pickle','rb') as f:\n",
    "    mypoly = pickle.load(f)\n",
    "mypoly"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "For (potentially) better performance, `pickle.dump` and `pickle.load` can be replaced with the [joblib](https://joblib.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html) versions. However, `dumps` and `loads` versions are not avaiable in joblib."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "<div class=\"alert alert-block alert-danger\">\n",
    "Never unpickle files from untrusted sources. This could lead to malicious code being excuted when the file is loaded.\n",
    "</div>"
   ]
  }
 ],
